captions.text:
Well, it's real simple.
You got two more quarters
and that's it.

Now most of you have been
playing this game for ten years.

You got two more quarters and
after that most of you will never play
this game again as long as you live.

<i>You all have known me</i>
<i>for a while...</i>

<i>and for a long time now, you've been</i>
<i>hearing me talk about being perfect.</i>

Well, I want you
to understand somethin'.
To me, being perfect...

is not about that
scoreboard out there.
It's not about winning.

It's about you and your
relationship to yourself and
your family and your friends.
<i>Bein'perfect...</i>

is about being able to look
your friends in the eye...

and <i>know</i> that you
didn't let them down.
Because you told 'em the truth.

<i>And that truth is, is that you did</i>
<i>everything that you could.</i>

<i>There wasn't one more thing</i>
<i>that you could've done.</i>
Can you live in that moment...
as best you can with clear eyes...
and love in your heart?
With joy in your heart?
If you can do that, gentlemen,
<i>then you're perfect.</i>
I want you to take a moment...

and I want you to look
each other in the eyes.

<i>I want you to put each other</i>
<i>in your hearts forever.</i>

Because forever's about to happen
here in just a few minutes.
I want you to close your eyes...

<i>and I want you to think</i>
<i>about Boobie Miles,</i>
<i>who is your brother.</i>

And he would die to be out there
on that field with you tonight.

<i>And I want you to put that</i>
<i>in your hearts.</i>
Boys, my heart is full.
My heart's full.
Ivory.
hallowed be thy name.

Thy kingdom come,
thy will be done--
On earth as it is in heaven.
Give us this day our daily bread...
and forgive us our trespasses.

As we forgive those
who trespass against us.

Lead us not into temptation
but deliver us from evil.

- For thine is the kingdom--
- The power and the glory forever.
Amen!

title: Friday Night Lights (9/10) Movie CLIP - Coach Gaines on Being Perfect (2004) HD

comments.text: Clear Eyes Big Hearts Can't Lose﻿
comments.author: J.C.C “BCL” A.O.L

comments.text:
I can't believe this movie only got a 3 out of 4 stars.  This is one of the 
best movies capturing the spirit and rite of passage of young men, who's 
lives are forever changed.   It's very rare when a movie gets it right. The 
film critics need a lobotomy.  This took place back when there were no cell 
phones, internet, or college loans handed out like Halloween candy.﻿

comments.author: Hoyte Goree

comments.text:
+Hoyte Goree The other poster probably misunderstood your point. The young 
people have to remember, this was back in the day, and prayer was very 
common--a standard accepted practice, especially in small towns. There was 
a different set of values then. That was my time on the field. I don't know 
what they do now, but yeah, your probably right, someone would object, and 
someone would probably lose their job, and the school might get sued. I 
wonder if that is why the movie only got a 3 out of 4 stars, because of the 
strong Christian beliefs by all?
comments.author: crusader68

comments.text:
+Andy Skim If you were replying to Oscar, as much as I understand and can 
see your perspective, I think you missed his point.
comments.author: duckboy07

comments.text:
I am probably considered by people who need to put labels on everyone an 
atheist, however I do not object at all to the prayer at the end of this 
speech and think it only enhances the power of the clip... first of all its 
common for kids and players like this to use their belief's to motivate 
themselves and without their beliefs, kids like this would not be as 
internally powerful as they are, I think this clip demonstrates that, and 
most importantly, the switching between teams during the prayer symbolizes 
similarities these players have, at a point in the movie where it seems 
like their are complete opposites, this clip starts to show a connectedness 
that throughout the game becomes more apparent. If you just look at the 
prayer as a prayer without looking at the significance of the meaning, 
you're just going to get offended and look like a narrow-minded idiot.
comments.author: Andy Skim

comments.text:
How would it be a crazy thing to object to something like that? Say you're 
the only Christian guy on a team filled with Muslims. Would you like to be 
part of their prayer? No, I bet you wouldn't. I'm pretty sure you're aware 
that this world is filled with people who believe in a deity and those who 
don't. The great thing about the USA is that we're allowed to practice 
whatever faith we want (or lack of). So yes, people who aren't Christian 
will object to this. No, it's not crazy, because that's their right and 
public high schools are suppose to follow the principle of the separation 
of the church and state. If you don't like it, too bad.

comments.text:
This movie stirred so many emotions in my soul and like many guys who 
played in HS, I always remember that time of my life, and will do so until 
I pass. I remember the camps, the practices, games, wins and losses. I 
remember the team, the plays, the weather, the classes, the feelings, just 
everything!!! Nowadays I coach my two sons and I am having the time of my 
life - so are they. Enjoy the time. Thanks to the guys who made this film, 
it struck a chord.
